Dear Lauren Skinner:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• Indicate how continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• Be signed and dated.
A six-month provisional license is recommended. If you do not contest the issuance of a
provisional license, you must indicate so in writing; this may be included in your corrective
action plan or in a separate document. If you contest the issuance of a provisional license,
you must notify this office in writing and an administrative hearing will be scheduled. Even
if you contest the issuance of a provisional license, you must still submit an acceptable
corrective action plan.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or
pushing a youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Supervisor 1 punched and kicked Youth A after Youth A hit her.
Investigation Interviews:
I spoke to Administrator 1 at the facility on 4/14/25. Administrator
1 reported Supervisor 1 and Supervisor 2 were terminated due to
this allegation. Supervisor 1 was terminated due to physical
aggression and Supervisor 2 was terminated due to verbal
aggressive behavior in the same incident. Administrator 1 reported
Supervisor 1 had multiple opportunities to leave the situation but
chose not to. Administrator 1 reported she had asked her to take a
break before the incident in the hallway, and she did not.
Administrator 1 reported Supervisor 1’s presence was not needed
in the situation.
The following interviews were completed with Officer and
DHHS Worker on 5/1/25 at the facility:
Youth A reported she was in the classroom when Supervisor 1
called a “Group Attention.” This meant all the youth stood in a
circle and gave their attention to discuss a topic. Youth A reported
Administrator 1 spoke to the youth and stated, “You have all been
disrespectful.” Youth A reported this upset her so she wanted to
leave the classroom. Youth A reported she walked to the
classroom door to leave and Staff 1 stepped in front of the door.
Youth A reported she pushed Staff 1 out of the way and walked
out the door into the hallway, into the unit, back into the hallway
and into the cafeteria. Youth A reported Staff 2 and Supervisor 1
were in the cafeteria with her. Both staff walked towards her and
she went around Staff 2, touching her but not pushing like she did
with Staff 1. Supervisor 1 called for a restraint and Youth A
reported she opened the cafeteria door to leave, and she was
pulled from behind. Youth A reported she started “swinging” on
Supervisor 1. Supervisor 1 pulled Youth A’s sweatshirt and her
2

hair. Youth A reported she heard Staff 2 say “stop.” Youth A
reported she grabbed Supervisor 1’s hair and pulled it. Supervisor
1 started punching and kicking her. Youth A reported she was
punched in the face, chest and shoulder by Supervisor 1. Youth A
reported Supervisor 1 also kicked her in the stomach. Youth A
reported she was yelling at Supervisor 1 and Supervisor 1 said,
“This is what you fucking get!” Youth A reported both she and
Supervisor 1 had each other’s hair and would not let go. Youth A
reported Supervisor 2, Staff 1, and Staff 2 were all in the hallway.
They restrained her by grabbing her arms and taking her to the
floor. Youth A reported they “swept” her feet to get her to the
ground. She was then in a supine restraint. Youth A reported she
started coughing up blood and felt lightheaded. Youth A reported
she told them she felt lightheaded, and Supervisor 2 stated, “Stop
fucking lying.” Youth A reported they let her up and she walked
away.
Supervisor 1 and Staff 2 followed her. Supervisor 1 started
laughing at Youth A and Youth A reported she said, “You want to
fight again?” Youth A reported she ran up on Supervisor 1 and
Supervisor 2 pushed her into the corner and started hitting her.
Youth A did not know if it was with a closed or open fist. Youth A
reported she, Supervisor 1, and Supervisor 2 were in the corner at
the end of the hallway. They were up against the door, and she
was pushed outside. Youth A reported Supervisor 2 told her, “Shut
up. That is what you get.” Youth A reported there was not a
restraint outside and she was able to just walk away from
Supervisor 1 and Supervisor 2.
Staff 1 was interviewed on 5/1/25 and reinterviewed on 5/15/25.
Staff 1 reported she was in the classroom with Youth A. Staff 1
reported Administrator 1 was discussing their behaviors with the
youth. Youth A got upset, went to the classroom door, grabbed
Staff 1’s upper body and shoved her away from the door.
Supervisor 1 and Staff 2 followed Youth A out of the classroom.
Staff 1 reported she heard someone yell “help,” so she went into
the hallway. Supervisor 1 and Staff 2 had Youth A in a standing
hold at this time. Staff 1 reported that Youth A was yelling at
Supervisor 1 and using profanity towards her. Staff 1 reported
Supervisor 1 was also yelling at Youth A. Staff 1 reported there
was definite tension between the two. Staff 1 reported she could
not remember what Staff 1 said, but she was yelling at Youth A.
Staff 1 reported Supervisor 2 came into the hallway and
Supervisor 1 called for a floor restraint. Staff 1 reported Supervisor
1 “swept” Youth A’s legs from under her to make her fall to the
3

floor for the restraint. Staff 1 reported Supervisor 1 should not
have been on the restraint due to the tension between her and
Youth Ar. When they were on the floor, Youth A began spitting
blood. Staff 1 reported Youth A began to whimper, and reported
Supervisor 1 stated, “Don’t cry now.” They Supervisor 1,
Supervisor 2, and Staff 4 let Youth A up from the restraint. Staff 1
reported she was holding Youth A's head on the restraint and saw
Youth A cough up blood and thought her eyes rolled or looked
crossed. Supervisor 1 and Staff 4 had Youth A’s arms and
Supervisor 2 had her legs. Once she was let up, Youth A yelled at
Supervisor 1, “Do you want round two, bitch?” Youth A ran
towards Supervisor 1 and they started fighting. Staff 1 reported
Supervisor 1 swung punches at Youth A. Staff 1 reported Youth A
hit Supervisor 1 as well. Staff 1 reported Supervisor 2 and
Supervisor 1 were upset and stating comments that were
aggressive, and they were not trying to deescalate Youth A.
Staff 1 reported she was unsure if Supervisor 2 punched Youth A
but reported she was physically aggressive with. Due to
everything that was going on she could not be sure if Supervisor 2
punched Youth A. She reported the aggression was outside of
(Crisis Prevention Institute (CPI) Staff 1 reported Supervisor 2 was
verbally and physically aggressive and made inappropriate
comments to Youth A but was unable to remember exactly what
they were.
Staff 2 reported Administrator 1 was talking to the youth in the
classroom when Youth A became upset. Staff 2 reported Youth A
pushed Staff 1 and walked out of the classroom and into the
cafeteria. Staff 2 reported she followed Youth A and went into the
cafeteria. Supervisor 1 walked in and Youth A walked out of the
cafeteria. Staff 2 reported Youth A was not yelling or physical at
this time. Staff 2 reported Supervisor 1 stated, “Restrain her" and
Supervisor 1 grabbed her arm and slid her arm under Youth A’s
shoulder. Staff 2 reported she attempted to grab Youth A’s other
arm but was unable to. Youth A became upset and grabbed Staff
2’s hair and started yelling. Supervisor 1 started to grab Youth A
and pulled Youth A’s hair. Staff 2 reported she heard Supervisor 1
say, “Today is the day I am gonna lose my job and beat your ass.”
Staff 2 reported the interaction between Supervisor 1 and Youth A
resembled an “outside fight.” Staff 2 reported CPI was not being
used at all by Supervisor 1. Staff 2 reported she attempted to
separate them and was calling out for help so that others would
come. Staff 2 reported she saw Supervisor 1 kick Youth A in the
stomach. She described it as if someone was kicking a football.
Staff 2 reported Supervisor 2 came into the hallway and an
4

emergency restraint was completed. Staff 2 reported she does not
know how Youth A was placed on the floor, but they completed a
floor restraint. Staff 2 reported he held Youth A’s right arm, Staff 1
was at her head, Supervisor 1 was on her left arm and Supervisor
2 was on her legs. During the restraint Youth A said to Supervisor
2, “I beat your friend’s ass” and Supervisor 2 responded by
saying, “I got you.” Youth A began to state she couldn’t breathe
and her eyes were crossing. They released her from the restraint.
Youth A began walking around and ran after Supervisor 1.
Supervisor 1 was at the end of the hallway by the door. When
Youth A arrived, both began swinging punches at each other. Staff
2 was unable to say who threw the first punch. Both hit each
other. Supervisor 2 then went into the corner with them and both
Supervisor 1 and Supervisor 2 were punching Youth A. Youth A
was also punching back. Supervisor 1 and Supervisor 2 pushed
Youth A out the door. Supervisor 1 and Supervisor 2 attempted to
restrain Youth A but were unable to and everyone stepped back
from each other and walked away. Staff 1 reported Youth A was
spitting up blood during the restraint but was unsure how that
might have occurred.
I interviewed Supervisor 1 on 6/18/25 via telephone. Supervisor 1
reported she was involved in a situation with Youth A on April 14th
at the facility. Supervisor 1 reported she had been terminated due
to the incident. Supervisor 1 reported she had just had an issue
with Youth A over the weekend and due to that incident, she
spoke to Administrator 1 to remove her as supervisor. Supervisor
1 reported she did not want to supervise anymore due the lack of
respect from the youth in the facility and lack of structure provided
by staff. After this meeting, Administrator 1 went to the classroom
and discussed disrespect with the youth. Youth A became upset,
pushed Staff 1 and went into the hallway. Staff 2 followed Youth A
out of the room. Supervisor 1 reported she did not initially follow
because she knew she was the target. Supervisor 1 reported she
went up front with Administrator 1 to discuss her position and
Youth A. A staff member present (unknown) told Supervisor 1 to
take a break from the unit and come back later. Administrator 1
left the building and Supervisor 1 reported she did not leave for a
break due to wanting to help the staff with Youth A.
Supervisor 1 reported she saw Youth A in the cafeteria with Staff
2. They were both sitting down at separate tables. Supervisor 2
came into the cafeteria and sat down at another table. She did not
think that Staff 2 should be alone with Youth A due to her
behaviors. There was no physical aggression shown by Youth A
5

at this point. Youth A was sitting at a table and got up when she
saw Supervisor 1 enter. Youth A attempted to walk out of the
cafeteria and Supervisor 1 reported she called for a standing hold.
When asked why she called for this, she thought Staff 2 was
pushed by Youth A. (Staff taking hold of the upper arms). Staff 2
was unable to get her hold stabilized so Youth A began punching
Supervisor 1 multiple times in the face. Youth A grabbed her hair
and they were “body to body” in the hallway. Supervisor 1
reported she only spoke, “Let my hair go.” She reported she struck
Youth A with a closed fist twice. Supervisor 1 reported she hit her
above her shoulder, but unsure exactly where. Supervisor 1
reported Staff 2 was attempting to pull them apart and got in the
middle of them and was able to transition into a standing hold.
Supervisor 2 came into the hallway and Supervisor 1 was able to
get Youth A into a full restraint on the floor. Supervisor 1 reported
she held Youth A’s left arm, Supervisor 2 had her legs, Staff 2 had
her right arm and Staff 1 had her head. Youth A was spitting on
staff and using profanity. Supervisor 1 reported Youth A began to
act like she was hyperventilating so they let her go. Youth A got
up and ran to the opposite end of the hallway. Supervisor 2 and
Staff 2 followed her. Youth A then ran toward Supervisor 1 and
punched her in the face. They were in the corner against the
doors leading outside. Supervisor 1 and Supervisor 2 were able
to get Youth A in a standing hold. Supervisor 1 and Supervisor 2
pushed the doors and went outside. Once outside Youth A was
released and no one was doing anything anymore.
Supervisor 1 reported no one else punched Youth A. Supervisor 1
reported Supervisor 2 was the only staff helping in the situation.
Supervisor 1 reported Administrator 1, Staff 1, and Staff 2 did not
help the situation and felt that if they were helping, this situation
might not have occurred the way it did. Supervisor 1 denied hitting
Youth A in the corner and denied saying anything inappropriate to
Youth A. Supervisor 1 also denied anyone else saying anything
inappropriate to Youth A.
Attempts were made to contact Supervisor 2 on 6/5/25, 6/11/25,
and 6/13/25. Supervisor 2 did not return phone calls and on
6/11/25 she reported she no longer works at the facility and did
not want to answer questions.
Video Observation:
I reviewed the video on 4/14/25 and an additional video clip
on 5/15/25. The incident occurred on 4/14/25. Video footage
was watched from 11:03:00-11:29:48am. There were two
angles watched.
6

Initial Hallway (outside of the cafeteria): Youth A, Supervisor 1
and Staff 2 are in the hallway. Supervisor 1 and Youth A both are
pulling each other’s hair. Staff 2 attempts to separate Youth A and
Supervisor 1. Youth A has her head down and starts to flail her
arms towards Supervisor 1. Supervisor 1’s right arm is holding
onto Youth A and she punches Youth A twice with a closed fist.
Youth A is hit in her left shoulder area both times. Supervisor 1
kicks Youth A in the stomach. Staff 2 continues to separate them
and is between them. Supervisor 1 grabs Youth A’s hair and then
releases.
Hallway Restraint: The initial view of staff and youth are outside
of the camera view. When in view, Staff 1 and Supervisor 1 are
attempting to place Youth A in a standing hold and achieve this,
but Supervisor 1 is no longer standing on the side of Youth A. She
is holding Youth A’s arm but facing her and pushes Youth A’s
chest with both arms. Youth A falls to the ground. Staff 1 is
present but not engaged physically. Supervisor 2 comes into view
and helps with a floor restraint. Youth A is in the restraint for
appropriately 23 minutes. Youth A is released from the restraint
and walks to the far end of the hallway. Staff 2 and Supervisor 2
follow her. At 11:29am Youth A runs toward Supervisor 1. Staff 2
and Supervisor 2 follow Youth A and are in the corner together.
Due to the angle of the camera, I was unable to see what
happened in the corner. The door is pushed open at the end of the
hallway and they Supervisor 1, Supervisor 2, and Youth A end up
outside.
Documentation Reviewed:
• Supervisor 1’s personnel file: Last central registry was
completed on 8/7/24. CPI training was completed on
6/18/24 and 6/25/24. On 3/27/24 she was trained in CPI
non-violent supportive communication skills. On 7/6/24, she
had training on CBT support. Supervisor 1 received a
discipline on 4/14/25, “per video, on 4/14/25, at 10:03am,
Supervisor 1 physically assaulted a client at Vassar
House.”
• Supervisor 2’s personnel file: Last central registry was
completed on 8/7/24. CPI training was completed on
4/3/25. On 4/21/24 she was trained in how to help staff use
interventions that reduce risks. On 7/16/24, she was trained
in interactions with clients and words of support. Supervisor
2 had disciplinary on 2/27/25 when she “used an
inappropriate child handling technique.” On 4/16/25 she
was terminated for “engaging in verbally aggressive
7

behavior and using inappropriate verbal communication
towards a client.”
• Critical Incident Report dated 4/14/15 and written by
Staff 2. The incident report includes a physical altercation
occurred between Supervisor 1 and Youth A. It does not
note an aggression or assault in the corner or the hallway.
• Written Statements:
o Staff 2’s statement pertaining to Supervisor 2’s
comments: Youth A questioned Supervisor 2 about
how she felt that she beat up her friend (Supervisor
1), and Supervisor 2 responded, “No, you got your
ass beat.”
o Supervisor 1’s Vassar Police Department
Statement: Supervisor 1 reported she feared for her
life due to the attacks of Youth A; therefore,
protected herself. Supervisor 1 did not note how she
protected herself in the report.
• After Visit Summary from Covenant Health Care: Youth
A was seen on 4/14/25 at 5:33pm. Final impression was
noted as, “acute left elbow strain, acute cervical strain,
acute lumbar strain, acute head contusion” Youth was
discharged with recommendations of using Tylenol or
Motrin as needed.
• Agency’s Prohibited Intervention policy: Physical
discipline is prohibited.
Analysis The agency is in violation of this rule. Based on interviews and
camera footage, as well as documentation, Youth A was
assaulted by Supervisor 1 and Supervisor 2.
• Supervisor 1 punched Youth A minimally twice and kicked
her in the stomach. Youth A, Staff 2, Supervisor 1 and
video review confirm this.
• Youth A and Staff 2 reported Supervisor 2 hit Youth A. Staff
1 reported Supervisor 2 was physically aggressive with
Youth A but could not specifically remember how.
• Supervisor 1 physically pushed Youth A to get her into a
supine restraint. The video confirms this.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
2024SIC0001725 approved 11/26/24; CAP approved 2/12/25
2025SIC000009 approved 11/26/24; CAP approved 12/12/24

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms
of intervention:
(iv) Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a
youth’s background or appearance or mental state.
Yelling, threats, ridicule, or humiliation are strictly
prohibited.
Violation Additional findings of rule noncompliance
Type
Allegation Supervisor 1 and Supervisor 2 verbally threatened, yelled or
ridiculed Youth A.
Investigation I spoke to Administrator 1 at the facility on 4/14/25. Administrator
1 reported Supervisor 2 was terminated due to aggressive verbal
behavior.
The following interviews were completed at the facility on
5/1/25:
Youth A reported during the incident on 4/14/25 she was yelling
at Supervisor 1 and Supervisor 1 said, “This is what you fucking
get!” Youth A reported both she and Supervisor 1 had each
other’s hair and would not let go. Youth A reported Supervisor 2,
Staff 1, and Staff 2 were all in the hallway. They restrained her.
Youth A reported she started coughing up blood and felt
lightheaded. Youth A reported she told them she felt lightheaded,
and Supervisor 2 stated, “Stop fucking lying.” Youth A reported
they let her up and she walked away. Supervisor 1 and Staff 2
followed her. Supervisor 1 started laughing at Youth A and Youth
A reported she said, “You want to fight again?” Youth A reported
she ran up on Supervisor 1 and Supervisor 2 pushed her into the
corner and started hitting her. Youth A reported Supervisor 2 told
her, “Shut up. That is what you get.”
Staff 1 reported Youth A was yelling at Supervisor 1 and using
profanity towards Supervisor 1. Staff 1 reported Supervisor 1 was
also yelling at Youth A. Staff 1 reported there was definite tension
between the two. Staff 1 reported she could not remember what
Staff 1 said, but she was yelling at Youth A. Staff 1 reported
Supervisor 2 came in the hallway and Supervisor 1 called for the
floor restraint. When they were in the restraint, Youth A began
spitting blood. Staff 1 reported Youth A began to whimper, and
reported Supervisor 1 stated, “Don’t cry now.” Staff 1 reported
9

Supervisor 2 was verbally and physically aggressive and made
inappropriate comments to Youth A but she was unable to
remember exactly what was said.
Staff 2 reported in the hallway before the restraint, she heard
Supervisor 1 say, “Today is the day I am gonna lose my job and
beat your ass.” Later when Youth A was in a supine restraint,
Youth A stated to Supervisor 2, “I beat your friend’s ass” and
Supervisor 2 responded by saying, “I got you.”
Supervisor 1 was interviewed via telephone on 6/18/25.
Supervisor 1 denied saying anything inappropriate to Youth A.
Supervisor 1 also denied anyone else saying anything
inappropriate to Youth A.
Attempts were made to contact Supervisor 2 on 6/5/25, 6/11/25,
and 6/13/25. Supervisor 2 did not return phone calls and on
6/11/25 she reported she no longer works at the facility and did
not want to answer questions
Documentation viewed:
• Supervisor 2’s personnel file: On 4/16/25 she was
terminated for “engaging in verbally aggressive behavior
and using inappropriate verbal communication towards a
client.”
• Agency’s Prohibited Intervention Policy: Policy prohibits
verbal threats, humiliation and verbal abuse.
Analysis The agency is in violation of this rule. Both Supervisor 1 and
Supervisor 2 were heard threatening, ridiculing, yelling and using
inappropriate language towards Youth A.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
2025SIC0000158 approved 2/10/25; CAP approved 3/12/25
10

Rule Code & R.400.4160 Emergency restraint
Section The use of emergency restraint as a lifesaving response for a
Description youth will be limited to:
(a) An emergency response to protect the youth or others from
unanticipated or severely aggressive behavior that places
the youth or others at serious threat of violence or injury if
no immediate intervention occurs.
Violation Additional Finding of noncompliance.
Type
Allegation Supervisor 1 attempted to place Youth A into a restraint when it
was not warranted.
Investigation Interviews:
The following interviews were completed at the facility on
5/1/25:
Youth A reported Staff 2 and Supervisor 1 were in the cafeteria
with her. Both staff walked towards her, and she went around Staff
2, touching her but not pushing her. Supervisor 1 called for a
restraint and Youth A reported she opened the cafeteria door to
leave, and she was pulled from behind.
Staff 2 reported Youth A pushed Staff 1 and walked out of the
classroom and into the cafeteria. Staff 2 reported she followed her
and went into the cafeteria with her. Supervisor 1 then walked in
and Youth A walked out of the cafeteria. Staff 2 reported Youth A
was not yelling or physical at this time. Staff 2 reported Supervisor
1 stated, “Restrain her" and Staff 1 grabbed her arm and slid her
arm under Youth A’s shoulder.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed via telephone on 6/18/25.
Supervisor 1 reported she saw Youth A in the cafeteria with Staff
2. They were both sitting down at separate tables. Supervisor 2
came into the cafeteria and sat down at another table. There was
no physical aggression shown by Youth A at this point. Youth A
was sitting at a table and got up when she saw Supervisor 1 enter.
Youth A attempted to walk out of the cafeteria and Supervisor 1
reported she called for a standing hold. (Staff taking hold of the
upper arms). Supervisor 1 reported she felt Youth A was to be
restrained due to her actions previously and aggressive
demeanor.
Documents Reviewed:
• Agency’s Behavior Management Policy: The agency
uses the CPI (Crisis Prevention Institute) model. The
11

standing hold is a technique that can be used but only to
protect others from aggressive behaviors.
• Critical Incident Report: The incident noted Youth A was
seated in the cafeteria. Youth A walked out of the cafeteria
when she noticed staff were following her. Supervisor 1
came through the door and Youth A became angry. This is
when Supervisor 1 called for a “high standing restraint.”
Analysis The agency is in violation of this rule. Youth A was seated in the
cafeteria and was not displaying physically aggressive behaviors.
Youth A became “angry” when Supervisor 1 came into the
cafeteria, but this was not a valid reason to use the CPI hold and
place Youth A into a restraint. The restraint was initiated when
there was not a need at the time to protect the youth or others
from unanticipated or severely aggressive behavior that places the
youth or others at serious threat of violence or injury.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
2023SIC0000529 approved 9/20/23; CAP approved 10/31/23
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended based on the willful and substantial
violations above that the agency license be changed to a 1st Provisional license
status upon the receipt of an acceptable CAP.
